title: Report an issue
name: BugReport
description: This POST method is used to send bug reports from the Website. Since it needs the Users Data, it requires authentication.

Body Parameters.description: Bug Report Message to sent
User Email

400.description: The report message is missing.

404.description: The specified user could not be found.

404.description: The specified challenge could not be found.

title: Create a new challenge
name: CreateChallenge
description: Creates a challenge. Cannot create associated tasks with this route. See CreateChallengeTasks.

Body Parameters.description: An object representing the challenge to be created
The id of the group to which the challenge belongs
The full name of the challenge
A shortened name for the challenge, to be used as a tag.
A short summary advertising the main purpose of the challenge; maximum 250 characters; if not supplied, challenge.name will be used.
A detailed description of the challenge
Whether or not a challenge is an official Habitica challenge (requires admin).
Number of gems offered as a prize to challenge winner.

Success 200.description: A shortened name for the challenge, to be used as a tag.
Id number of newly created challenge.
Number of gems offered as prize to winner (can be 0).
Object containing IDs of the challenge's tasks and rewards in their preferred sort order.
Boolean indicating if this is an official Habitica challenge.

examples.title: Successful response with single challenge

400.description: Invalid or missing parameter in challenge body.

401.description: User does not have enough gems to offer this prize.

404.description: The specified group could not be found.
The specified user could not be found.

Boolean indicating if this is an official Habitica challenge.

title: Get challenges for a group
description: Get challenges hosted in the specified group.
name: GetGroupChallenges

Success 200.description: An array of challenges sorted with official challenges first, followed by the challenges in order from newest to oldest.
A shortened name for the challenge, to be used as a tag.
Id number of newly created challenge.
Number of gems offered as prize to winner (can be 0).
Object containing IDs of the challenge's tasks and rewards in their preferred sort order.

title: Get challenges for a user
name: GetUserChallenges
description: Get challenges the user has access to. Includes public challenges, challenges belonging to the user's group, and challenges the user has already joined. Returns 10 results per page.

Success 200.description: An array of challenges sorted with official challenges first, followed by the challenges in order from newest to oldest.
A shortened name for the challenge, to be used as a tag.
Id number of newly created challenge.
Number of gems offered as prize to winner (can be 0).
Object containing IDs of the challenge's tasks and rewards in their preferred sort order.
Boolean indicating if this is an official Habitica challenge.

examples.title: Successful response with array of challenges

Query Parameters.description: This parameter can be used to specify the page number for the user challenges result (the initial page is number 0).
If set to true it limits results to challenges where the user is a member.
If set to owned it limits results to challenges owned by the user. If set to not_owned it limits results to challenges not owned by the user.
Optional query parameter to filter results to challenges that include (even partially) the search query parameter in the name or description.
Optional comma separated list of categories. If set it limits results to challenges that are part of the given categories.

400.description: Page query parameter must be a positive integer

404.description: The specified user could not be found.

Success 200.description: A shortened name for the challenge, to be used as a tag.
Id number of newly created challenge.
Number of gems offered as prize to winner (can be 0).
Object containing IDs of the challenge's tasks and rewards in their preferred sort order.
Boolean indicating if this is an official Habitica challenge.

examples.title: Successful response with single challenge

404.description: The specified challenge could not be found.
The specified user could not be found.

title: Clear flags
description: Resets the flag count on a chat message. Retains the id of the user's that have flagged the message. (Only visible to moderators)

permission.name: Admin
permission.title: Moderators
permission.description: Contributors of tier 8 or higher can use this route.

name: ClearFlags

Path Parameters.description: The group id ('party' for the user party and 'habitrpg' for tavern are accepted)

400.description: A group ID is required
A chat ID is required

404.description: Must be a moderator to use this route
The specified group could not be found.
The specified message could not be found.

title: Delete chat message from a group
name: DeleteChat
description: Delete's a chat message from a group

Query Parameters.description: The last message's ID fetched by the client so that the whole chat will be returned only if new messages have been posted in the meantime.

Path Parameters.description: The group _id ('party' for the user party and 'habitrpg' for tavern are accepted).

Success 200.description: The updated chat array or an empty object if no message was posted after previousMsg.

400.description: Only the creator of the message and admins can delete a chat message.
A group ID is required
A chat ID is required

404.description: The specified group could not be found.
The specified message could not be found.

title: Flag a group chat message
description: A message will be hidden from chat if two or more users flag a message. It will be hidden immediately if a moderator flags the message. An email is sent to the moderators about every flagged message.
name: FlagChat

Path Parameters.description: The group id ('party' for the user party and 'habitrpg' for tavern are accepted)

Body Parameters.description: explain why the message was flagged

Success 200.description: The timestamp of the message in milliseconds
The number of flags the message has
The User ID of the author of the message
The username of the author of the message

400.description: A group ID is required
A chat ID is required

404.description: Chat messages cannot be flagged more than once by a user
The message has already been flagged.
The specified group could not be found.
The specified message could not be found.

title: Get all available content objects
description: Does not require authentication.
name: ContentGet

Query Parameters.description: Language code used for the items' strings. If the authenticated user makes the request, the content will return with the user's configured language.

Success 200.description: Various data about the content of Habitica. The content route contains many keys, but the data listed below are the recommended data to use.
The mystery sets awarded to paying subscribers.
The gear that can be equipped.
Detailed information about the gear, organized by type.
The full key of each equipment.
The skills organized by class. Includes cards and visual buffs.
The animals available in the Time Traveler's stable, separated into pets and mounts.
All the pets with extra info.
All the mounts with extra info.
The types of quests that a user can own.
Data about available body size options.
Data about the various subscriptions blocks.

Query Parameters.description: The number of coupon codes to generate

400.description: The request was missing the count query parameter or used an invalid event.

title: Run cron
name: Cron
description: This causes cron to run. It assumes that the user has already been shown the Record Yesterday's Activity ("Check off any Dailies you did yesterday") screen and so it will immediately apply damage for incomplete due Dailies.

title: Render a user avatar as an HTML page
name: ExportUserAvatarHtml
description: This HTML export feature is not currently working (https://github.com/HabitRPG/habitica/issues/9489).

Path Parameters.description: The User ID of the user

Success 200.description: An html page rendering the user's avatar.

groupDescription: These routes allow you to download backups of your data. Note: They are intended to be used on the website only and as such are part of the private API and may change at any time.

When pagination is enabled for public guilds this parameter can be used to specify the page number (the initial page is number 0 and not required).

title: Assign a group task to a user or users
description: Assign users to a group task

title: Delete user's completed todos
name: ClearCompletedTodos
description: Deletes all of a user's completed To Do's except those belonging to active Challenges and Group Plans.

title: Create a new task belonging to a challenge
description: Can be passed an object to create a single task or an array of objects to create multiple tasks.
name: CreateChallengeTasks

Path Parameters.description: The id of the challenge the new task(s) will belong to

Body Parameters.description: The text to be displayed for the task
Task type, options are: "habit", "daily", "todo", "reward".
User's attribute to use, options are: "str", "int", "per", "con".
Determines if a checklist will be displayed
Extra notes
Due date to be shown in task list. Only valid for type "todo."
Difficulty, options are 0.1, 1, 1.5, 2; equivalent of Trivial, Easy, Medium, Hard.
Array of reminders, each an object that must include: a UUID, startDate and time. For example {"id":"ed427623-9a69-4aac-9852-13deb9c190c3", "startDate":"1/16/17","time":"1/16/17" }

Values "weekly" and "monthly" enable use of the "repeat" field. All frequency values enable use of the "everyX" field. Value "monthly" enables use of the "weeksOfMonth" and "daysOfMonth" fields. Frequency is only valid for type "daily".

List of objects for days of the week, Days that are true will be repeated upon. Only valid for type "daily". Any days not specified will be marked as true. Days are: su, m, t, w, th, f, s. Value of frequency must be "weekly". For example, to skip repeats on Mon and Fri: "repeat":{"f":false,"m":false}
Value of frequency must be "daily", the number of days until this daily task is available again.
Number of days that the task has consecutively been checked off. Only valid for type "daily"
Array of integers. Only valid for type "daily"
Array of integers. Only valid for type "daily"
Date when the task will first become available. Only valid for type "daily"
Only valid for type "habit" If true, enables the "+" under "Directions/Action" for "Good habits"
Only valid for type "habit" If true, enables the "-" under "Directions/Action" for "Bad habits"
Only valid for type "reward." The cost in gold of the reward

201.description: An object if a single task was created, otherwise an array of tasks

400.description: Task type must be one of "habit", "daily", "todo", "reward".
Path 'text' is required.
Task short names can only contain alphanumeric characters, underscores and dashes.
x is not a valid enum value for path (body param).

title: Cast a skill (spell) on a target
name: UserCast

Query Parameters.description: Query parameter, necessary if the spell is cast on a party member or task. Not used if the spell is casted on the user or the user's current party.

examples.title: Query example:
examples.content:
Cast "Pickpocket" on a task:
 https://habitica.com/api/v3/user/class/cast/pickPocket?targetId=fd427623...

Cast "Tools of the Trade" on the party:
 https://habitica.com/api/v3/user/class/cast/toolsOfTrade

Success 200.description: Will return the modified targets. For party members only the necessary fields will be populated. The user is always returned.

description: Skill Key to Name Mapping Mage: fireball="Burst of Flames", mpheal="Ethereal Surge", earth="Earthquake", frost="Chilling Frost" Warrior: smash="Brutal Smash", defensiveStance="Defensive Stance", valorousPresence="Valorous Presence", intimidate="Intimidating Gaze" Rogue: pickPocket="Pickpocket", backStab="Backstab", toolsOfTrade="Tools of the Trade", stealth="Stealth" Healer: heal="Healing Light", protectAura="Protective Aura", brightness="Searing Brightness", healAll="Blessing" Transformation Items: snowball="Snowball", spookySparkles="Spooky Sparkles", seafoam="Seafoam", shinySeed="Shiny Seed"

400.description: enough mana.

title: Change class
description: User must be at least level 10. If ?class is defined and user.flags.classSelected is false it'll change the class. If user.preferences.disableClasses it'll enable classes, otherwise it sets user.flags.classSelected to false (costs 3 gems).
name: UserChangeClass

Query Parameters.description: Query parameter - ?class={warrior|rogue|wizard|healer}

Error 4xx.description: Not enough gems, if class was already selected and gems needed to be paid.
To change class you must be at least level 10.

Body Parameters.description: The user's password if the account uses local authentication, otherwise the localized word "DELETE"
User's optional feedback explaining reasons for deletion

Error 4xx.description: Missing password.
Wrong password.
Account deletion feedback is limited to 10,000 characters. For lengthy feedback, email ${TECH_ASSISTANCE_EMAIL}.

title: Delete social authentication method
description: Remove a social authentication method from a user profile. The user must have another authentication method enabled.
name: UserDeleteSocial

Path Parameters.description: The type of item to equip or unequip.
The item to equip or unequip

Success 200.description: Optional success message for unequipping an items

Error 4xx.description: Item is not in inventory, item doesn't exist, or item is of the wrong type.

examples.title: Item not owned or doesn't exist.

Query Parameters.description: The amount of food to feed. Note: Pet can eat 50 units. Preferred food offers 5 units per food, other food 2 units.

Error 4xx.description: :pet not found in user.items.pets
Invalid pet name supplied.
:food not found in user.items.food Note: also sent if food name is invalid.
:Not enough food to feed the pet as requested.
:You try to feed too much food. Action ancelled.

title: Get the authenticated user's profile
name: UserGet
description: The user profile contains data related to the authenticated user including (but not limited to): Achievements; Authentications (including types and timestamps); Challenges memberships (Challenge IDs); Flags (including armoire, tutorial, tour etc...); Guilds memberships (Guild IDs); History (including timestamps and values, only for Experience and summed To Do values); Inbox; Invitations (to parties/guilds); Items (character's full inventory); New Messages (flags for party/guilds that have new messages; also reported in Notifications); Notifications; Party (includes current quest information); Preferences (user selected prefs); Profile (name, photo url, blurb); Purchased (includes subscription data and some gem-purchased items); PushDevices (identifiers for mobile devices authorized); Stats (standard RPG stats, class, buffs, xp, etc..); Tags; TasksOrder (list of all IDs for Dailys, Habits, Rewards and To Do's).

Query Parameters.description: A list of comma-separated user fields to be returned instead of the entire document. Notifications are always returned.

examples.title: Result:

title: Get anonymized user data
name: UserGetAnonymized
description: Returns the user's data without: Authentication information, NewMessages/Invitations/Inbox, Profile, Purchased information, Contributor information, Special items, Webhooks, Notifications.

title: Get equipment/gear items available for purchase for the authenticated user
name: UserGetBuyList

title: Create a new webhook - BETA
name: AddWebhook

Body Parameters.description: The webhook's id
The webhook's URL
A label to remind you what this webhook does
If the webhook should be enabled
The webhook's type.
The webhook's options. Will differ depending on type. Required for groupChatReceived type. If a webhook supports options, the default values are displayed in the examples below

examples.title: Task Activity Example
User Activity Example
examples.content:
{
  "enabled": true,
  "url": "https://some-webhook-url.com",
  "label": "My Activity Webhook",
  "type": "userActivity",
  "options": { // set at least one to true
    "petHatched": false,  // default
    "mountRaised": false, // default
    "leveledUp": false,   // default
  }
}

examples.title: Quest Activity Example
examples.content:
{
  "enabled": true,
  "url": "https://some-webhook-url.com",
  "label": "My Quest Webhook",
  "type": "questActivity",
  "options": { // set at least one to true
    "questStarted": false,  // default
    "questFinished": false, // default
    "questInvited": false,  // default
  }
}

201.description: A label for you to keep track of what this webhooks is for
Whether the webhook should be sent
The options for the webhook (See examples)

groupDescription: Webhooks fire when a particular action is performed, such as updating a task, or sending a message in a group. Your user's configured webhooks are stored as an Array on the user object under the webhooks property.

400.description: A body parameter passed in the request did not pass validation.

name: UserDeleteWebhook

Path Parameters.description: The id of the webhook to delete

Success 200.description: The remaining webhooks for the user

title: Edit a webhook - BETA
name: UserUpdateWebhook
description: Can change url, enabled, type, and options properties. Cannot change id.

Path Parameters.description: URL parameter - The id of the webhook to update

Body Parameters.description: The webhook's URL
A label to remind you what this webhook does
If the webhook should be enabled
The webhook's type.
The webhook's options. Will differ depending on type. The options are enumerated in the add webhook examples.

title: Get the state for the game world
description: Does not require authentication.
name: WorldStateGet

Success 200.description: Boolean, true if world boss quest is underway
Object with NPC names as Boolean properties, true if they are affected by Rage Strike.
String, Quest content key for the world boss
Number, Current Health of the world boss
Number, Current Rage of the world boss
String, trailing component of NPC image filenames

title: Returns the i18n JS script.
description: Returns the i18n JS script to make all the i18n strings available in the browser under window.i18n.strings. Does not require authentication.
name: i18nBrowserScriptGet
